newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani money rates dive, close sharply lower.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani money rates dive, close sharply lower.

text.p: Pakistani money market rates dived on Thursday to close sharply lower before the Friday-Saturday weekend, dealers said.

The market started with offers at 16.50 percent in uncertainty about the likely outcome of rates while there was no consensus on available liquidity, one dealer at the Standard Chartered Bank in Karachi said.
The rates started to slip in the end, trading as low as 6.00 percent, the dealer said. "The market is likely to stay soft for the next couple of days." -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
